title: lazy
content:
lazy lets you defer loading componentâ€™s code until it is rendered for the first time.

Call lazy outside your components to declare a lazy-loaded React component:

See more examples below.

lazy returns a React component you can render in your tree. While the code for the lazy component is still loading, attempting to render it will suspend. Use <Suspense> to display a loading indicator while itâ€™s loading.

load receives no parameters.

You need to return a Promise or some other thenable (a Promise-like object with a then method). It needs to eventually resolve to an object whose .default property is a valid React component type, such as a function, memo, or a forwardRef component.
